output.dependency: The name of the beer (one column) and its style (another column) are semantically dependent as the beer name implies its flavor or type, which is defined by the style.

The packaging size (one column, represented in ounces) and its alcohol percentage (another column) may have a syntactic dependency, as different sizes often correlate to similar alcohol content values.
The brewery name and its location (city) are semantically dependent since the brewery operates in that city.
The city (one column) and the state (another column) are semantically dependent as every city belongs to a specific state.
The brewery name (one column) and the state (another column) are semantically dependent, as breweries are often known to be in specific states.
